GSLB_Monitor.title: GSLB_Monitor
GSLB_Monitor.description: Declares a monitor that verifies the availability and/or performance status of a particular protocol, service, or application

target.title: Target (Address:Port)
target.description: Specifies the IP address and service port of the resource that is the destination of this monitor. Format is ip:port

interval.title: Interval
interval.description: Specifies, in seconds, the frequency at which the system issues the monitor check when either the resource is down or the status of the resource is unknown

timeout.title: Timeout
timeout.description: Specifies the number of seconds the target has in which to respond to the monitor request

probeTimeout.title: Probe Timeout
probeTimeout.description: Specifies the number of seconds after which the system times out the probe request to the system

ignoreDownResponseEnabled.title: Ignore Down Response
ignoreDownResponseEnabled.description: Specifies whether the monitor immediately marks an object down when it receives a down response. If enabled, the monitor ignores the down response for the duration of timeout. The default is false (disabled)

GSLB_Monitor_External.description: Additional Monitor class properties available when monitorType = external

pathname.title: pathname
pathname.description: Tmsh object path name of an imported existing external monitor (e.g. /Common/arg_example)

expand.title: Expand
expand.description: If true (default), expand backquoted variables in script

script.title: External monitor script
script.description: Bash(1) script which implements external monitor

arguments.title: Arguments
arguments.description: Arguments to specified external monitor (will be backquote-expanded)

environmentVariables.description: Specifies user defined command line parameters that the external program requires.

GSLB_Monitor_HTTP.description: Additional Monitor class properties available when monitorType = http

reverseEnabled.title: Reverse Enabled
reverseEnabled.description: When enabled, a successful check marks the monitored object down instead of up. You can use the Reverse mode only if you configure both the send and receive options

send.title: Send String
send.description: Specifies the text string that the monitor sends to the target object. If you do not specify a value for both the send and receive options, the monitor performs a simple service check and connect only

receive.title: Receive String
receive.description: Specifies the text string that the monitor looks for in the returned resource. If you do not specify a value for both the send and receive options, the monitor performs a simple service check and connect only

receiveStatusCodes.title: Receive Status Codes
receiveStatusCodes.description: Specifies the status codes that the monitor looks for in the returned resource

transparent.title: Transparent
transparent.description: Enables monitoring of pool members through firewalls. The default value is false (disabled)

GSLB_Monitor_HTTPS.description: Additional Monitor class properties available when monitorType = https

clientCertificate.title: Client certificate
clientCertificate.description: BIG-IP AS3 pointer to client Certificate declaration, for TLS authentication (optional)

sniServerName.title: SNI Server Name
sniServerName.description: Server Name Indication (SNI) property for HTTPS monitor

GSLB_Monitor_ICMP.description: Additional Monitor class properties available when monitorType = gateway-icmp

probeInterval.title: Probe Interval
probeInterval.description: Specifies the frequency at which the BIG-IP system probes the host server

probeAttempts.title: Probe Attempts
probeAttempts.description: Specifies the number of times the BIG-IP system attempts to probe the host server, after which the BIG-IP system considers the host server down or unavailable

transparent.title: Transparent
transparent.description: Enables monitoring of pool members through firewalls. The default value is false (disabled)

GSLB_Monitor_TCP_Half_Open.description: Additional Monitor class properties available when monitorType = tcp-half-open

probeInterval.title: Probe Interval
probeInterval.description: Specifies the frequency at which the BIG-IP system probes the host server

probeAttempts.title: Probe Attempts
probeAttempts.description: Specifies the number of times the BIG-IP system attempts to probe the host server, after which the BIG-IP system considers the host server down or unavailable

transparent.title: Transparent
transparent.description: Enables monitoring of pool members through firewalls. The default value is false (disabled)

count.title: Count
count.description: Number of monitor probes after which the connection to the database will be terminated.  Count value of zero indicates that the connection will never be terminated.

database.title: Database
database.description: The name of the database with which the monitor attempts to communicate.

passphrase.title: Passphrase
passphrase.description: Passphrase if any for query authentication

allowReuse.description: If true, other declaration objects may reuse this value

receive.title: Receive = up
receive.description: Mark node up upon receipt of this (backquote-expanded) string

receiveColumn.title: Receive Column
receiveColumn.description: Specifies the column in the database where the system expects the specified Receive String to be located.  Specify this property only if you configure the Send and Receive properties.

receiveRow.title: Receive Row
receiveRow.description: Specifies the row in the database where the system expects the specified Receive String to be located.  Specify this property only if you configure the Send and Recieve properties.

send.title: Send
send.description: Send this (backquote-expanded) string to query node

targetAddress.title: Address
targetAddress.description: IP address monitor should probe; if empty (default) then pool member address

targetPort.title: Port
targetPort.description: L4 port (if any) monitor should probe; if 0 (default) then pool member port

timeUntilUp.title: Time until up
timeUntilUp.description: Delay between successful probe and sending traffic to node (seconds)

upInterval.title: Up-Interval
upInterval.description: Poll interval when service is already up (seconds)

username.title: Username
username.description: Username if any for query authentication

clientCertificate.title: Client certificate
clientCertificate.description: BIG-IP AS3 pointer to client Certificate declaration, for TLS authentication (optional)

codesDown.title: Codes = down
codesDown.description: List of status codes meaning service is down (0 matches any code)

codesUp.title: Codes = up
codesUp.description: List of additional (to all 1/2/3xx) status codes meaning service is up (0 matches any code)

headers.title: Headers
headers.description: SIP headers to send in probes (if any)--separate by newlines (backquote-expanded)

request.title: Request
request.description: SIP request to send in probes (default empty)

targetAddress.title: Address
targetAddress.description: IP address monitor should probe; if empty (default) then pool member address

targetPort.title: Port
targetPort.description: L4 port (if any) monitor should probe; if 0 (default) then pool member port

timeUntilUp.title: Time until up
timeUntilUp.description: Delay between successful probe and sending traffic to node (seconds)

upInterval.title: Up-Interval
upInterval.description: Poll interval when service is already up (seconds)

base.title: Base
base.description: Specifies the location in the LDAP tree from which the monitor starts the health check

chaseReferrals.title: Chase Referrals
chaseReferrals.description: Specifies, whether, upon receipt of an LDAP referral entry, the referral is followed

filter.title: Filter
filter.description: Specifies an LDAP key which the monitor searches

mandatoryAttributes.title: Mandatory Attributes
mandatoryAttributes.description: Specifies whether the target must include attributes in its response to be considered up

passphrase.title: Passphrase
passphrase.description: Passphrase if any for query authentication

allowReuse.description: If true, other declaration objects may reuse this value

security.title: Security
security.description: Specifies the secure protocol type for communications with the target

targetAddress.title: Address
targetAddress.description: IP address monitor should probe; if empty (default) then pool member address

targetPort.title: Port
targetPort.description: L4 port (if any) monitor should probe; if 0 (default) then pool member port

timeUntilUp.title: Time until up
timeUntilUp.description: Delay between successful probe and sending traffic to node (seconds)

upInterval.title: Up-Interval
upInterval.description: Poll interval when service is already up (seconds)

username.title: Username
username.description: Username if any for query authentication

domain.title: Domain
domain.description: Mail domain to check, if any (backquote-expanded)

targetAddress.title: Address
targetAddress.description: IP address monitor should probe; if empty (default) then pool member address

targetPort.title: Port
targetPort.description: L4 port (if any) monitor should probe; if 0 (default) then pool member port

timeUntilUp.title: Time until up
timeUntilUp.description: Delay between successful probe and sending traffic to node (seconds)

upInterval.title: Up-Interval
upInterval.description: Poll interval when service is already up (seconds)

GSLB_Monitor_TCP.description: Additional Monitor class properties available when monitorType = tcp

reverseEnabled.title: Reverse Enabled
reverseEnabled.description: When enabled, a successful check marks the monitored object down instead of up. You can use the Reverse mode only if you configure both the send and receive options

send.title: Send String
send.description: Specifies the text string that the monitor sends to the target object. If you do not specify a value for both the send and receive options, the monitor performs a simple service check and connect only

receive.title: Receive String
receive.description: Specifies the text string that the monitor looks for in the returned resource. If you do not specify a value for both the send and receive options, the monitor performs a simple service check and connect only

transparent.title: Transparent
transparent.description: Enables monitoring of pool members through firewalls. The default value is false (disabled)

GSLB_Monitor_UDP.description: Additional Monitor class properties available when monitorType = udp

debugEnabled.title: Debug Enabled
debugEnabled.description: When enabled, the monitor sends error messages and additional information to a log file created and labeled specifically for this monitor. The default is false (disabled)

probeAttempts.title: Probe Attempts
probeAttempts.description: Specifies the number of times the BIG-IP system attempts to probe the host server, after which the BIG-IP system considers the host server down or unavailable

probeInterval.title: Probe Interval
probeInterval.description: Specifies the frequency at which the BIG-IP system probes the host server

reverseEnabled.title: Reverse Enabled
reverseEnabled.description: When enabled, a successful check marks the monitored object down instead of up. You can use the Reverse mode only if you configure both the send and receive options

send.title: Send String
send.description: Specifies the text string that the monitor sends to the target object. If you do not specify a value for both the send and receive options, the monitor performs a simple service check and connect only

receive.title: Receive String
receive.description: Specifies the text string that the monitor looks for in the returned resource. If you do not specify a value for both the send and receive options, the monitor performs a simple service check and connect only

transparent.title: Transparent
transparent.description: Enables monitoring of pool members through firewalls. The default value is false (disabled)
